meanings.def: the organ in the chest that sends blood around the body, usually on the left in humans
examples: The patient's heart stopped beating for a few seconds.
I could feel my heart pounding in my chest (= because of excitement, etc.).
to have a weak heart
heart disease/problems
to have a heart condition
heart patients/surgery
a heart transplant
The heart pumps blood through the body.
a triple heart bypass operation

meanings.def: the outside part of the chest where the heart is
examples: She clasped the photo to her heart.

meanings.def: a thing that is like a heart in shape, often red and used as a symbol of love; a symbol like a heart used to mean the verb ‘love’
examples: The words ‘I love you’ were written inside a big red heart.
She was drawing hearts on the cover of a loose-leaf binder.

meanings.def: the place in a person where the feelings and emotions are thought to be, especially those connected with love
examples: She has a kind heart.
Have you no heart?
He returned with a heavy heart (= sad).
Her novels tend to deal with affairs of the heart.
The story captured the hearts and minds of a generation.
His sad story touched her heart.
the mysteries of the human heart
He had no heart for arguing.
He really puts his heart into his singing.
He set off with a light heart.
He smiled and her heart melted.
Her words pierced my heart.
Inside, his heart was slowly breaking.
Just follow your heart and you'll be happy.
Let's sing it one more time from the beginning—and put some heart into it!
My heart aches when I think of their sorrow.
Relief filled his heart.
everything your heart could desire

meanings.def: having the type of character or personality mentioned
examples: simple-hearted
pure-hearted
black-hearted

meanings.def: the most important part of something
examples: heart of something the heart of the matter/problem
The committee's report went to the heart of the government's dilemma.
at the heart of something The distinction between right and wrong lies at the heart of all questions of morality.
the issue at the heart of modern government
at the/its heart The story, at its heart, is a simple tale of loss and rediscovery.
Buddhism, at the heart, is about harmony.

meanings.def: the part that is in the centre of something
examples: heart of something a quiet hotel in the very heart of the city
at the/its heart an open space with a small arena at the heart
Manchester contains at its heart a rather extended commercial district.

meanings.def: the smaller leaves in the middle of a cabbage, lettuce, etc.
one of the four suits (= sets) in a pack of cards, with red heart symbols on them
examples: the queen of hearts
Hearts is/are trumps.

meanings.def: one card from the suit called hearts
examples: Who played that heart?

meanings.def: used to say that when you are away from somebody that you love, you love them even more
used to say what somebody is really like even though they may seem to be something different
examples: He's still a socialist at heart.

meanings.def: if something is etched on your heart, memory, etc. you remember it because it has made a strong impression on you
to make somebody feel very unhappy
examples: She broke his heart when she called off the engagement.
It breaks my heart to see you like this.

meanings.def: using only your memory
examples: I've seen the show so often I know all the songs by heart.
She's learnt the whole speech off by heart.

meanings.def: if you have a change of heart, your attitude towards something changes, usually making you feel more friendly, helpful, etc.
examples: Dan did not want to get married but recently he’s had a change of heart.
He said he's not coming, but he might have a change of heart.

meanings.def: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody
used to emphasize that you are telling the truth or will do what you promise
examples: I saw him do it—cross my heart.

meanings.def: used to compare two things and say that one of them is better
examples: Look at him dance! Eat your heart out, Fred Astaire (= he dances even better than Fred Astaire).

meanings.def: to be able or willing to do something
examples: Can you find it in your heart to forgive her?
He couldn't find it in himself to trust anyone again.

meanings.def: in a way that is sincere
examples: I beg you, from the bottom of my heart, to spare his life.
It was clearly an offer that came from the heart.
I could tell he spoke from the heart.

meanings.def: to make somebody feel positive, especially when they thought that they had no chance of achieving something
to give your love to one person
used to ask somebody to be kind and/or reasonable
examples: Have a heart! I’ve nowhere else to stay!

meanings.def: to be a very kind person
to be a person who does not show other people sympathy
to want somebody to be happy and successful even though your actions may not show this
examples: Although he was sometimes too strict with his children, he had their best interests at heart.

meanings.def: to be very dear to somebody
examples: He'll always have a place in my heart.

meanings.def: with a lot of energy and enthusiasm
examples: They threw themselves heart and soul into the project.

meanings.def: used to say that you do not feel sympathy for somebody
examples: ‘I have to go to Brazil on business.’ ‘My heart bleeds for you!’

meanings.def: used to say that you feel a lot of sympathy for somebody
examples: Our hearts go out to the families of the victims.

meanings.def: somebody feels nervous or frightened about something
examples: My heart was in my mouth as I opened the envelope.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody’s intentions are kind and sincere even though they sometimes do the wrong thing
used to say that you are not very interested in or enthusiastic about something
examples: Her heart isn't in her job.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody has a sudden feeling of happiness or excitement
examples: My heart leapt at the news.
Her heart leaped with joy.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody has a sudden feeling of fear, excitement, etc.
examples: My heart missed a beat when I saw who it was.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody suddenly feels sad or depressed about something
examples: My heart sank when I saw how much work there was left.

meanings.def: because of kind feelings, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you

meanings.def: to tell somebody all your problems, feelings, etc.
examples: Finally, he broke down in tears and poured out his heart to her.

meanings.def: to want something very much
examples: They’ve set their heart on a house in the country.

meanings.def: very unhappy or disappointed
to cry noisily for a long time because you are very sad

meanings.def: to make somebody fall in love with you
to make somebody be afraid, etc.

meanings.def: to feel more positive about something, especially when you thought that you had no chance of achieving something

meanings.def: to be very upset by something that somebody says or does

meanings.def: to strongly affect you in an emotional way
